sourceMeaningMnemonic: An <radical>insect</radical> specializing in <radical>construction</radical> builds a <kanji>rainbow</kanji>. Did you ever wonder where rainbows come from? Construction insects build them. Construction insects build rainbows.
meaningInfo: Imagine this insect with a construction hat on, building a rainbow. He works very fast. The resulting rainbow is beautiful!
readingMnemonic: This <kanji>rainbow</kanji> building insect is so <reading>needy</reading> (<ja>にじ</ja>). He is needy because he needs everyone to look at his rainbow and praise him for what he’s done. “Look at my rainbow! Look at how good it is and I am! I’m so needy! Needy for praise and recognition!”
readingInfo: Imagine this construction insect being all whiny and needy for attention and stuff. It’s pathetic. Hear him whine and whine because of how needy he is.
